data.oai_dc:dc: Data from: Drought, post-dispersal seed predation and the establishment of epiphytic bromeliads (Tillandsia spp.)

Post-dispersal predation in epiphytes is poorly documented. Inthe course of a study on in situ germination of two Tillandsia species in adeciduous forest in Yucatan, Mexico, post-dispersal seed predation rates bythe Yucatan deer mouse (Peromyscus yucatanicus) averaged 90%.Post-dispersal predation was thus more limiting than drought.
